cms.name: WordPress
cms.support: Open Source; supported by most hosting companies
cms.capabilities: Themes, Plugins, Custom Post Types, REST API, Media Management
cms.limitations: Security vulnerabilities through plugins; requires frequent updates; performance requires optimization

cms.name: Joomla
cms.support: Open Source; maintained by Open Source Matters
cms.capabilities: Built-in multilingual support, flexible user access controls, strong content organization
cms.limitations: Steeper learning curve than WordPress; fewer themes/plugins; smaller community

cms.name: Drupal
cms.support: Open Source; supported by the Drupal Association
cms.capabilities: Enterprise-level security, highly customizable, robust taxonomy, powerful user permissions
cms.limitations: Complex for beginners; high development cost; fewer ready-made themes

cms.name: Wix
cms.technology: Cloud-based SaaS, proprietary editor, integrated hosting
cms.capabilities: Drag-and-drop builder, app marketplace, built-in SEO tools, hosting included
cms.limitations: Limited backend customization; vendor lock-in; cannot self-host; template switching issues

cms.name: Squarespace
cms.support: Commercial platform; supported by Squarespace, Inc.
cms.technology: Cloud-based SaaS, proprietary templates, integrated CDN/hosting
cms.capabilities: High-end templates, strong ecommerce tools, built-in analytics, drag-and-drop editor
cms.limitations: Limited extensions, no server-side access, less developer control compared to open-source CMS
